keyMoments.title: Garp Confirmed as Luffy's Grandfather
keyMoments.description: Garp confirms to Luffy and the Marines that he is Luffy's grandfather, revealing the family connection between the Marine hero and the pirate.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes one of the most important family relationships in the series, connecting Luffy to a legendary Marine.

keyMoments.title: Reveals His Harsh Training Methods
keyMoments.description: Garp describes his extreme training methods for young Luffy, including throwing him into dangerous situations to toughen him up.
keyMoments.significance: Provides insight into Luffy's childhood and explains his incredible durability and fearlessness.
keyMoments.quote: I threw you over ravines, into a jungle filled with dangerous animals, and used balloons to make you fly!

keyMoments.title: Demonstrates the 'Fist of Love'
keyMoments.description: Garp punches Luffy with his 'Fist of Love' technique, which hurts Luffy despite his rubber body.
keyMoments.significance: Shows that Luffy can be hurt by certain attacks, foreshadowing later revelations about advanced combat techniques.

keyMoments.title: Explains the Three Great Powers
keyMoments.description: Garp explains the balance of power in the One Piece world, describing the Four Emperors, Seven Warlords, and Marines.
keyMoments.significance: Critical world-building that establishes the fundamental power structure of the series.
keyMoments.quote: The Three Great Powers are the Four Emperors, the Seven Warlords of the Sea, and the Marines.

keyMoments.title: Reveals Shanks is a Yonko
keyMoments.description: Garp reveals that Shanks, who inspired Luffy to become a pirate, is one of the Four Emperors.
keyMoments.significance: Recontextualizes Shanks' power level and raises the stakes for Luffy's promised reunion with him.
keyMoments.quote: That Red-Haired Shanks you admire so much... he's one of the Four Emperors!

keyMoments.title: Accidentally Reveals Dragon is Luffy's Father
keyMoments.description: Garp accidentally lets slip that Luffy's father is Monkey D. Dragon, immediately regretting the disclosure.
keyMoments.significance: The most important revelation in the episode, establishing Luffy's incredible lineage and connecting him to the Revolutionary Army.
keyMoments.quote: Your father is Monkey D. Dragon!

abilities.description: A punch that can hurt Luffy despite his rubber body, powered by 'love' according to Oda.

relationships.description: Garp is Luffy's grandfather and trained him harshly as a child, hoping to make him a Marine.

evolutionMoments.description: Garp confirms he is Luffy's grandfather and reveals his training methods.

relationships.description: Garp is Dragon's father, though Dragon chose a revolutionary path opposing the World Government.

evolutionMoments.description: Garp reveals that Dragon is his son and Luffy's father.

relationships.description: Garp has been training Koby to become a Marine officer.

evolutionMoments.description: Koby appears as a Marine officer trained under Garp.

relationships.description: Garp has been training Helmeppo to become a Marine officer.

evolutionMoments.description: Helmeppo appears as a Marine officer trained under Garp.

reveals.information: Trained young Luffy with extreme methods
Can hurt Luffy with 'Fist of Love'

name.japanese: モンキー・D・ドラゴン

keyMoments.title: Revealed as Luffy's Father
keyMoments.description: Garp accidentally reveals that Dragon is Luffy's father, shocking everyone including Luffy himself.
keyMoments.significance: One of the most important revelations in One Piece, establishing Luffy's connection to the Revolutionary Army and the world's most wanted man.

keyMoments.title: Identified as Most Wanted Criminal
keyMoments.description: Robin explains that Dragon is the leader of the Revolutionary Army and labeled as the most dangerous criminal in the world by the World Government.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Dragon's role as the primary opposition to the World Government and sets up future conflicts.

keyMoments.title: Flashback Shows Dragon Saved Luffy in Loguetown
keyMoments.description: A flashback reveals that Dragon was present in Loguetown and helped Luffy escape from Smoker.
keyMoments.significance: Recontextualizes the Loguetown arc and shows Dragon was watching over Luffy despite their lack of relationship.

relationships.description: Dragon is Luffy's father, though they have no personal relationship as Dragon never raised him.

evolutionMoments.description: Dragon is revealed to be Luffy's father. Luffy didn't even know he had a father.

relationships.description: Dragon is Garp's son, though he chose a path opposing the World Government.

evolutionMoments.description: Garp reveals that Dragon is his son.

reveals.information: World's most dangerous criminal according to World Government
Was present in Loguetown and helped Luffy escape

keyMoments.title: Returns as Marine Officer
keyMoments.description: Koby reappears for the first time in 246 episodes, now as a Master Chief Petty Officer who has trained under Garp.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Koby's incredible growth from timid cabin boy to capable Marine, fulfilling his dream from Episode 1.
keyMoments.quote: We've been training under Vice Admiral Garp to become Marine Officers!

keyMoments.title: Reaffirms Friendship with Luffy
keyMoments.description: Koby and Luffy reaffirm their friendship despite being on opposite sides as Marine and pirate.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates that their bond transcends their opposing allegiances.

relationships.description: Koby and Luffy are friends from the beginning of Luffy's journey, despite being on opposite sides.

evolutionMoments.description: Koby and Luffy reunite and reaffirm their friendship.

relationships.description: Garp has been training Koby, helping him become a capable Marine officer.

evolutionMoments.description: Koby reveals he has been training under Garp.

reveals.information: Promoted to Master Chief Petty Officer
Has been training under Vice Admiral Garp

keyMoments.title: Returns as Marine Officer
keyMoments.description: Helmeppo reappears as a Chief Petty Officer, transformed from the spoiled brat he once was through training under Garp.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Helmeppo's redemption and growth, transforming from antagonist to dedicated Marine.

relationships.description: Garp has been training Helmeppo, helping him become a capable Marine officer.

evolutionMoments.description: Helmeppo reveals he has been training under Garp.

relationships.description: Helmeppo and Koby have become friends and training partners under Garp.

evolutionMoments.description: Helmeppo and Koby appear together as Marine officers.

reveals.information: Has been training under Vice Admiral Garp

keyMoments.title: Revealed as One of the Four Emperors
keyMoments.description: Garp reveals that Shanks has become one of the Four Emperors, the most powerful pirates in the world.
keyMoments.significance: Massively elevates Shanks' status and recontextualizes his power level from the early episodes, showing how strong he truly is.

relationships.description: Shanks inspired Luffy to become a pirate and gave him his iconic straw hat.

evolutionMoments.description: Garp reveals Shanks is now one of the Four Emperors, showing how powerful Luffy's role model is.

reveals.information: Revealed to be one of the Four Emperors
